meanings.sent1: The broken toy was unsell because no one wanted to buy it.
meanings.sent2: The old, torn book was unsell at the garage sale.
meanings.sent3: The unsell lemonade stand had no customers all day.
meanings.sent4: Her unsell painting gathered dust in the corner of the room.
meanings.sent5: The unsell car sat in the driveway for months without any offers.

meanings.definition: To fail to persuade someone to buy something.
meanings.sent1: Despite his best efforts, he could not unsell the outdated product.
meanings.sent2: The salesman tried his best but still managed to unsell the new vacuum cleaner.
meanings.sent3: She jokingly tried to unsell the idea of a beach vacation to her friends.
meanings.sent4: The magician's performance was so captivating that it was impossible to unsell his tricks.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's enthusiasm for the subject made it hard to unsell the importance of studying.
